notes.left: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.
To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

description.right: ICD-10 diagnostic code for type of cancer in a prior malignancy.

description.right: If donor has history of prior malignancy, indicate laterality of previous diagnosis.

primary_site.name: primary_site
primary_site.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

Other and unspecified female genital organs
Other and unspecified major salivary glands
Other and unspecified male genital organs
Other and unspecified parts of biliary tract
Other and unspecified parts of mouth
Other and unspecified parts of tongue
Other endocrine glands and related structures
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system
Spinal cord, cranial nerves, and other parts of central nervous system

description.left: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.
description.right: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumor_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

notes.left:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications
notes.right: This field depends on the selected pathological staging system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

notes.left: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

description.left: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
description.right: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Please refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

description.left: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
description.right: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

left: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen
right: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

left: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

deleted: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

notes.left:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications
notes.right: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

central_pathology_confirmed.name: central_pathology_confirmed
central_pathology_confirmed.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
submitter_primary_diagnosis_id.description: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen acquisition was related to.

meta.notes: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

reference_pathology_confirmed.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
reference_pathology_confirmed.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

notes.left: To prevent data collisions, submitter_id cannot begin with any of the ARGO ID prefixes.  The restricted prefixes include: `DO`, `SP`, `SA`,`TR`,`FU`, `PD`.

description.left: Age that the donor was first diagnosed with cancer, in years. This should be based on the earliest diagnosis of cancer.
description.right: Age that the donor was first diagnosed with cancer, in years.

description.left: The code to represent the cancer type using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en) classification.
description.right: The code to represent the cancer type using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2016/en#/) classification.

description.left: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).
description.right: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

notes.left:
This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

notes.left: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work).
Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair
notes.right:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction 
 Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work) 
 Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

stage_suffix.name: stage_suffix
stage_suffix.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

cancer_type_additional_information.name: cancer_type_additional_information
cancer_type_additional_information.description: Additional details related to the cancer type that are not covered by the ICD-10 code provided in the cancer_type field.

Depending on the treatment_type(s) selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.
notes.right: Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treament details may be required to be submitted.

description.left: Indicate if the treatment was the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis.
description.right: Indicate if the treamtment was the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis.

description.left: The interval between the primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.
description.right: The interval between primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

notes.left: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

description.left: The duration of treatment regimen, in days.
description.right: The duration of treatment regimen, in days

description.right: The donors's response to the applied treatment regimen. (Source: RECIST)

line_of_treatment.name: line_of_treatment
line_of_treatment.description: Indicate the line of treatment if it is not the primary treatment.

days_per_cycle.name: days_per_cycle
days_per_cycle.description: Indicate the number of days in a treatment cycle.

number_of_cycles.name: number_of_cycles
number_of_cycles.description: Indicate the number of treatment cycles.

outcome_of_therapy.name: outcome_of_therapy
outcome_of_therapy.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

toxicity_type.name: toxicity_type
toxicity_type.description: If the treatment was terminated early due to acute toxicity, indicate whether it was due to hemotological toxicity or non-hemotological toxicity.

hemotological_toxicity.name: hemotological_toxicity
hemotological_toxicity.description: Indicate the hemotological toxicities which caused early termination of the treatment. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

adverse_events.name: adverse_events
adverse_events.description: Report any treatment related adverse events. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

clinical_trial_number.description: Based on the clinical_trial_database, indicate the unique NCT or EudraCT clinical trial identifier of which the donor is a participant.

chemotherapy_drug_name.name: chemotherapy_drug_name
chemotherapy_drug_name.description: Name of agent or drug administered to patient as part of the chemotherapy treatment regimen.

meta.notes: This field uses a controlled vocabulary gathered from the DrugBank database of drug names.

drug_rxnormcui.name: drug_rxnormcui
drug_rxnormcui.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

drug_name.name: drug_name

description.left: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression.
description.right: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

notes.left:
This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
